answerText: Tyndall effect [or Tyndall scattering][10] Colloids are substances dispersed in other substances. This type of colloid, in which a gas is dispersed in a solid, includes examples like "solid smoke."
heading: STIMPY |2015 | MIT A - Michigan B | 4 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This effect is similar to Rayleigh scattering, but the particles causing it are larger than those used in Rayleigh scattering. For 10 points each: [10] Name this effect, exhibited by colloids, in which light is scattered by particles in its path.
